alert.note: Alert for Chase (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 29 at 9:35PM CDT until May 30 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Chase County in southwestern Nebraska... * Until midnight MDT. * At 835 PM MDT, Runoff from earlier heavy rainfall continues and doppler radar indicates periods of rain will continue for the next 1 to 2 hours. Flash flooding is likely ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of South Central Chase County This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 25 and 28. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
